intro: Brickelliastrum fendleri, commonly known as the desert bluebonnet, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its striking blue to violet flowers bloom in late spring, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant's small, linear leaves are often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat.
